byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani and Elisabetta Povoledo contributed reporting from Rome.
byline.original: By JIM YARDLEY and LAURIE GOODSTEIN

abstract: Lawyer for Kim Davis, Kentucky county clerk who disobeyed court order to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples, reveals she met secretly with Pope Francis during his visit to Washington, DC; says Francis gave her two rosaries and told her to 'stay strong.'
lead_paragraph: The Vatican confirmed that the pope met with Ms. Davis, who defied a court order on same-sex marriage, but would not elaborate.

headline.main: Pope Francis Met With Kim Davis, Kentucky County Clerk, in Washington
headline.print_headline: County Clerk Who Denied Gay Couples Visited Pope

snippet: The Vatican confirmed that the pope met with Ms. Davis, who defied a court order on same-sex marriage, but would not elaborate.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
